intro: Scleria guahensis, commonly known as the Guianan sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wetland or swampy environments, thriving in moist, acidic soils. Its morphology includes triangular stems and narrow leaves, characteristic of many sedges. Scleria guahensis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, contributing to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
